page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
We went to 3 people's homes to interview them about changes that had taken place over the last 30 years.
More houses have been built which, of course, has put the population up though there is a population decline in the area generally. One half-timbered house has been demolished, trees at the end of the Avenue in Lyneal have been cut down.A large caravan site has developed at the Yetchleys nr. Lyneal and the canal boat holiday industry has grown alot.
SCHOOL: Toilets were outside and of the wooden seat and bucket variety. Dinners were served in the classroom where the washing up was also done. Music was from a wound up gramophone.
